The method of claim 5, wherein the second set of GUI items comprise a set of image editing and image tagging GUI items for display when a user has not activated any particular sets of editing tools, and the first set of GUI items are for display irrespective of whether a user has selected a particular set of editing tools.

10. The method of claim 5, wherein the image-viewing application is for operation on a device with both portrait and landscape modes, and the first and second GUIs are both for operation in landscape mode.
11. A machine readable medium storing an image-viewing application for execution by at least one processing unit, the image-viewing application comprising sets of instructions for:
displaying an image in a graphical user interface (GUI) on a touch-sensitive display;
receiving a touch input over the displayed image through the touch sensitive display to activate a particular GUI tool;
when the GUI is in a left-handed mode, displaying the particular tool in a first orientation; and
when the GUI is in a right-handed mode, displaying the particular tool in a first orientation.
12. The machine readable medium of claim 11, wherein the tool is a circular zoom tool that magnifies a portion of the displayed image.

13. The machine readable medium of claim 12, wherein the tool comprises magnification information, the magnification information located on (i) the right side of the tool when the GUI is in the left-handed mode and (ii) the left side of the tool when the GUI is in the right-handed mode.
14. The machine readable medium of claim 12, wherein a zoom level of the tool is modifiable.
15. The machine readable medium of claim 11, wherein the touch input comprises two separate touch inputs that at least partially coincide in time.
16. A machine readable medium storing an image-viewing application for execution by at least one processing unit, the image-viewing application comprising sets of instructions for:
displaying an image in a graphical user interface (GUI) on a touch-sensitive display;
receiving two separate touch inputs over the displayed image through the touch-sensitive display, the two separate touch inputs at least partially coincidental;
in response to the touch inputs, activating a moveable GUI tool for magnifying a portion of the displayed image.
17. The machine readable medium of claim 16, wherein the set of instructions for activating the moveable GUI tool comprises sets of instructions for:
calculating a midpoint between the two separate touch inputs; and centering the moveable GUI tool at the calculated midpoint.
18. The computer readable medium of claim 16, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for:
receiving a counterclockwise rotation gesture of the two touch inputs;
decreasing a magnification level of the GUI tool in response to the counterclockwise rotation gesture when the GUI is in a right-handed mode; and
increasing the magnification level of the GUI tool in response to the counterclockwise rotation gesture when the GUI is in a left-handed mode.
19. The computer readable medium of claim 16, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for:

receiving a clockwise rotation gesture of the two touch inputs; and increasing a magnification level of the GUI tool in response to the clockwise rotation gesture when the GUI is in a right-handed mode; and
decreasing the magnification level of the GUI tool in response to the clockwise rotation gesture when the GUI is in a left-handed mode.
20. The computer readable medium of claim 16, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for:
receiving a single touch input over the GUI tool followed by a movement of the single touch input along the touch-sensitive display to a different location in the image display area; and
moving the GUI tool to the different location in response to the movement of the single touch input.
21. A machine readable medium storing an image-viewing application for execution by at least one processing unit, the image-viewing application comprising sets of instructions for:

displaying a thumbnail display area comprising a set of thumbnails on a particular side of a touch-sensitive display, the thumbnails for selection in order to display corresponding images in a preview display area;

through the touch-sensitive display, receiving a swipe gesture over the thumbnail display area directed towards the particular side of the touch-sensitive display; and in response to receiving the swipe gesture, removing the thumbnail display area from the display.

22. The machine readable medium of claim 21, wherein the set of instructions for removing the thumbnail display area from the display comprises a set of instructions for displaying the thumbnail display area sliding off the particular side of the touch-sensitive display.
23. The machine readable medium of claim 21, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for:

with the thumbnail display area removed from the display, receiving a second swipe gesture through the touch-sensitive display near the particular side of the touch- sensitive display and directed away from the particular side of the touch-sensitive display; and
in response to receiving the second swipe gesture, moving the thumbnail display area back into the display.
24. The machine readable medium of claim 21, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for:

through the touch-sensitive display, receiving (i) a touch over a border between the thumbnail display area and the image display area and (ii) a subsequent drag gesture away from the particular side of the touch-sensitive display; and
when the drag gesture away from the particular side reaches a threshold distance, rearranging the set of thumbnails in the thumbnail display area into an increased number of columns.

25. The machine readable medium of claim 24, wherein the set of thumbnails has a maximum number of columns, wherein when the maximum number of columns is reached, the application does not execute the instructions for rearranging the set of thumbnails into an increased number of columns.

26. The machine readable medium of claim 21, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises sets of instructions for: through the touch-sensitive display, receiving (i) a touch over a border between the thumbnail display area and the preview display area and (ii) a subsequent drag gesture towards the particular side of the touch-sensitive display; and
when the drag gesture toward the particular side reaches a threshold distance, rearranging the set of thumbnails in the image browser display area into a decreased number of columns.

27. The machine readable medium of claim 26, wherein the set of thumbnails has a minimum number of columns, wherein when the minimum number of columns is reached, the application does not execute the instructions for rearranging the set of thumbnails into a decreased number of columns.
28. A machine readable medium storing an image-viewing application for execution by at least one processing unit, the image-viewing application comprising sets of instructions for:

displaying, on a touch-sensitive display, a thumbnail display area comprising an ordered set of thumbnails, the thumbnails for selection in order to display corresponding images in an image display area;

through the touch-sensitive display, receiving (i) a first touch input over a first thumbnail in the set of thumbnails and a (ii) a second touch input over a second thumbnail in the set of thumbnails, wherein the first and second touch inputs at least partly coincide in time; and
selecting images corresponding to the first thumbnail, the second thumbnail, and each image between the first and second thumbnails in the ordered set.
29. The machine readable medium of claim 28, wherein the image-viewing application further comprises a set of instructions for displaying the selected images in the image display area.

30. The machine readable medium of claim 29, wherein the set of instructions for displaying the selected images in the image display area comprises a set of instructions for displaying each of the selected images with a same visual weighting.
31. The machine readable medium of claim 28, wherein the first and second touch inputs comprise tap inputs.
32. The machine readable medium of claim 28, wherein the first and second touch inputs comprise press and hold inputs.
33. A method for providing an image-viewing application, the method comprising: providing a thumbnail display area for displaying a set of thumbnails that each corresponds to an image;
providing an image display area for displaying one or more images when thumbnails corresponding to the images are selected;

providing a set of modules for (i) selecting only a first image when touch input of less than a threshold duration is received over the thumbnail corresponding to the first image and (ii) selecting the first image while maintaining the selection of a previously- selected second image when touch input of at least the threshold duration is received over the thumbnail corresponding to the second image.
